rationale: This species has been recorded from eastern Côte d'Ivoire and southwestern Ghana where it is impacted by mining and deforestation. Its extent of occurrence is estimated to be about 150,000 km², but its area of occupancy could be close to meeting 2,000 km² threshold for the Vulnerable category. Currently it has been recorded from more than 10 locations. The species is assessed as Near Threatened (close to meeting B2), and it needs to be monitored as the population is declining.
evaluator: Snoeks, J., Darwall, W. & Smith, K.
